Cloud Working Group meetings are open to: Cloud Working Group meetings are open to all current and potential contributors on Wednesdays, 11 AM US Eastern at fedora-meeting{'@'}irc.libera.chat.
Fedora Cloud is created by a team in the: Fedora Cloud is created by a team in the Fedora Project community called the Cloud Working Group. It is comprised of official members who have decision-making powers, as well as other contributors. Learn more about this group and how you can get involved on the Cloud Working Group website.
Join a community of users and contributo: Join a community of users and contributors focused on Fedora Cloud.
The **Fedora Cloud** tag on Fedora's Dis: The **Fedora Cloud** tag on Fedora's Discourse-based discussion forum is a great place to connect with other Fedora Cloud users and contributors.
The Fedora Cloud Working Group sends mee: The Fedora Cloud Working Group sends meeting agendas and minutes and has discussions on their mailing list at cloud{'@'}lists.fedoraproject.org.
You can chat with the Fedora Cloud Worki: You can chat with the Fedora Cloud Working Group via Matrix: #cloud:fedoraproject.org.
You can view, file, and discuss Fedora C: You can view, file, and discuss Fedora Cloud issues on the [Fedora Cloud issue tracker](https://pagure.io/fedora-cloud/issues).
